change_description: This class is not useful internally anymore and will be removed in 6.0
UseClassicSimilarityfor equivilent behavior, or consider switching toBM25Similaritywhich will become the new default in Lucene 6.0

UseQueryobjects instead: when queries are wrapped in aConstantScoreQueryor in aBooleanClause.Occur.FILTERclause, they automatically disable the score computation so theFilterclass does not provide benefits compared to queries anymore.
This class is not useful internally anymore and will be removed in 6.0
FilteredQuery will be removed in Lucene 6.0. It should be replaced with aBooleanQuerywith oneBooleanClause.Occur.MUSTclause for the query and oneBooleanClause.Occur.FILTERclause for the filter.
You can useQueryobjects directly for filtering by usingBooleanClause.Occur.FILTERclauses in aBooleanQuery.
This class is outdated and no longer used since Lucene 2.9. Nuke it finally!
This is here only to ease transition from the pre-4.0 APIs.
This is here only to ease transition from the pre-4.0 APIs.
Bad naming of constant; useVersion.LUCENE_4_0_0instead (this constant actually points toVersion.LUCENE_4_0_0_ALPHAto match whole 4.0 series).
Boolean queries should be created once withBooleanQuery.Builderand then considered immutable. SeeBooleanQuery.Builder.add(org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanClause).
UseDisjunctionMaxQuery.DisjunctionMaxQuery(Collection, float)instead and provide all clauses at construction time
UseDisjunctionMaxQuery.DisjunctionMaxQuery(Collection, float)instead and provide all clauses at construction time
Boolean queries should be created once withBooleanQuery.Builderand then considered immutable. SeeBooleanQuery.Builder.add(org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanClause).
Phrase queries should be created once withPhraseQuery.Builderand then considered immutable. SeePhraseQuery.Builder.add(Term).
Phrase queries should be created once withPhraseQuery.Builderand then considered immutable. SeePhraseQuery.Builder.add(Term, int).
All clauses should be provided atconstruction-time.
per-query boosts are deprecated in favour ofBoostQuery
UseCodecUtil.checkFooter(org.apache.lucene.store.ChecksumIndexInput)instead, this should only used for files without checksums
Cloning was only useful for modifying boosts. Now thatQuery.setBoost(float)is deprecated, queries should be considered immutable.
This comparator is only a transition mechanism
This comparator is only a transition mechanism
Use of this method can only lead to race conditions. Try to actually obtain a lock instead.
Only for reading existing formats. Encode maps withDataOutput.writeSetOfStrings(Set)instead.
Only for reading existing formats. Encode maps withDataOutput.writeMapOfStrings(Map)instead.

change_id: 5.4.0_org.apache.lucene.search.IndexSearcher.searchAfter(ScoreDoc, Query, Filter, int, Sort, boolean, boolean)
source_element_name: org.apache.lucene.search.IndexSearcher.searchAfter(ScoreDoc, Query, Filter, int, Sort, boolean, boolean)

change_description: Boolean queries should be created once withBooleanQuery.Builderand then considered immutable. SeeBooleanQuery.Builder.setMinimumNumberShouldMatch(int).
Phrase queries should be created once withPhraseQuery.Builderand then considered immutable. SeePhraseQuery.Builder.setSlop(int).
This is here only to ease transition from the pre-4.0 APIs.
Use theBooleanQuery.Builderclass to build boolean queries.
Use theBooleanQuery.Builderclass to build boolean queries.
Use thePhraseQuery.Builderclass to build phrase queries.
Only for reading old 4.0 and 4.1 segments
Only for reading old 4.0 and 4.1 segments
Only for reading old 4.0 and 4.1 segments
You should plug aQueryCacheintoIndexSearcherinstead and let it make decisions.
(March 2011) Not normally used, to be removed from Lucene 4.0. This class implementing Comparable is to be removed at the same time.
This class will be removed in Lucene 6.0. DiversifiedTopDocsCollector should be used instead with a maximum number of hits per key equal to 1.
Migrate to one of the newer suggesters which are much more RAM efficient.
Migrate to one of the newer suggesters which are much more RAM efficient.
